case_title: Mehr ABDUR RASHID vs Ch. SHER ALI

accussed_details.name: Ch. SHER ALI
accussed_details.designation: Member of National Assembly (Constituency NA-65, Faisalabad-IX)
allegation: Election procured through corrupt and illegal practices

complaint_summary: The appellant challenged the election of Ch. Sher Ali as Member of the National Assembly from Constituency NA-65, alleging corrupt and illegal practices.
investigation_summary: The petitioner failed to deposit process fees and diet money for summoning official witnesses and did not produce witnesses for cross-examination. The Tribunal noted gross negligence in pursuing the case.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal dismissed the petition due to the appellant's failure to substantiate allegations, produce witnesses for cross-examination, and comply with procedural requirements.
legal_arguments: Failure to deposit process fees constitutes gross negligence.
Tribunal discretion to adjourn hearings must be exercised on sound judicial principles.
Non-compliance with Election Commission procedures for trial of election petitions.
statutes: Representation of the People Act, 1976 (No. LXXXV of 1976)

witness_statement.Shahadat Khan: Affidavit filed but not presented for cross-examination.
witness_statement.Muhammad Anwar: Affidavit filed but not presented for cross-examination.

witness_statement.Malik Rehmat Ali: Affidavit filed but not presented for cross-examination.
witness_statement.Munawar Hussain: Affidavit filed but not presented for cross-examination.

witness_statement.Sheikh Muhammad Ashraf: Affidavit filed but not presented for cross-examination.

key_issues: Failure to deposit process fees for summoning witnesses.
Non-compliance with procedural requirements for election petitions.
Gross negligence in pursuing the case.

maxims.Delegation of ministerial duties: The act of depositing process fees is a ministerial duty that could have been delegated.

legal_terms.Process Fee: Fee required to summon witnesses or proceed with legal actions.

words_and_phrases.Gross Negligence: Failure to exercise reasonable diligence in pursuing a case.
words_and_phrases.Ministerial Duty: Administrative tasks that do not require judicial discretion.

summary_vector_notes: Election petition dismissed due to gross negligence by the petitioner in failing to deposit process fees and produce witnesses for cross-examination. Tribunal exercised discretion based on judicial principles and found no sufficient cause for adjournment.
